intro: Machaerina riparia, commonly known as the river flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Machaerina riparia is often found growing along riverbanks and in moist, well-drained soils. It has historical significance for Māori, who used its fibers for weaving.
